404.cta: Take me to a safe place
404.description: The page you're looking for it's on quarantine, we're working hard to recover it soon!
404.seo-description: There's been a problem and we cannot find the page
404.title: Page not found

contribute.body0: Share your feedback! We want to keep improving and provide the best service to everyone in need. Send us your message at support@coronamail.org
contribute.title: Want to help?

about.seo-description: CoronaMail it's a platform created to send letters to people infected with the Covid-19 virus.
about.title: About CoronaMail

what.body0: coronamail.org it's a nonprofit platform to send support and love through letters to everyone isolated and/or infected and thus ease their quarantine.
what.body1: The goal of CoronaMail is to make company, amuse and send love through letters, stories or tales from the "outside" to everyone infected or in quarantine that are feeling lonely.
what.body2: We believe that people infected by Covid-19 (on top of fight the virus) they have to deal with solitude. What's a better way to break this isolation during the quarantine than through letters. Letters that aside of their content they say "We're together in this situation".
what.title: What's this?

who.body0: We're a team of volunteers that wants to help overcome together this pandemic. We got the idea at the beginning of the quarantine and we started working on this platform. After that we noticed that some Hospitals created some emails so everyone could send messages to the victims. And so we rushed to finish this project.
who.body1: We are B√†rbara, an events organizer, and Rub√©n, a software engineer. We're very happy to share this project with everyone willing to contribute. Thanks in advance.
who.title: About us

tour.outbox: Write letters that the Covid-19 patients will read.
tour.inbox: You'll get the volunteers letters as soon as they send them in this inbox.
tour.send-mail: Let's go write your first letter!

app.inbox-empty: Here you'll see your received letters

register.body0: This data will be always anonymized by most strict security directives. We're GDPR compliant. Not even us will be able to get your personal data.

register.country-description: We use this to match the letters by proximity.
register.email-description: The email has to be valid. We'll send you a confirmation email.

register.language-description: We use this to match the letters with people that can understand them.
register.name-description: It doesn't have to be your real name, use an alias if you prefer so.

cookies.text: We use our own and third-party cookies to improve the user experience and power our service. If you continue browsing you're accepting our #{legal}. Keep going and eat these cookies! üç™

error.mandatory-content: You have to write something. You don't want to send an empty letter, ain't?

tour.language: Select the letter's language. We'll send it to people that speaks such language.
tour.subject: Add a catchy title.
tour.content: Write here your letter. You can explain anything you like (how was your day, a story, one anecdote or a simple support message). Be respectful. Remember the letters can be shared, do not post anything private that can compromise you.

home.claim: Spreading love in times of virus

2.answer: Yes, you can write letters in any language. All the people that register as readers shall indicate which languages do they understand. In the other hand, every time a letter is created it includes in which language. Our system will distribute the letters accordingly.
2.question: Can I write the letters in any language?

6.answer: The website as well as other integrated services are fully accessible. Everyone is welcome here.
6.question: If I'm a person with special capabilities can I use the service?

0.answer: You can explain anything you like (how was your day, a story, one anecdote or a simple support message). Be respectful. Remember the letters can be shared, do not post anything private that can compromise you.
0.question: I want to send a letter, what I should write on?

1.answer: No, the letters are anonymous and we take privacy very seriously. However, the recipient of the message can react with an emoji.
1.question: Can the letters be answered?

4.answer: You won't receive any. This is to improve the efficiency of the delivery system. However, the letters can be shared you might find one in the social networks.
4.question: Can I read letters if I'm not a sick person?

5.answer: You can change your status in "settings".
5.question: What if I was sick and healed or the other way around?

3.answer: We need the email to ensure the proper function of the system. We'll use it only to notify you about received letters. It looks like everlasting lie from all the services, but our code is public so anyone can check that's true.
3.question: Why do I have to register?

7.answer: We don't store any of your information that's not needed for the service. However, absolutely all the data is encrypted and we follow the strict GDPR rules.
7.question: What happens with my data?

8.answer: Not yet, we're still considering it.
8.question: Can I attach documents or images to the letters?

9.answer: Write letters! We need tones of them! You can send us feedback, as well. Any question or suggetion you can send it to support@coronamail.org.
9.question: How can I help?

assist.description: register and mark yourself as a reader. We'll make sure you get letters for your patients.
assist.title: I'm a health worker and I want to read letters to patients,

features.description: The goal is to send anonymous letters full of love and support to everyone in need of them. They won't feel alone anymore while the fight against Covid-19.

receive.description: register and mark yourself as a reader. You'll receive lovely letters.
receive.title: I want to read letters,

send.description: register and write a letter. We'll make sure your letter gets to a sick person.
send.body0: The more you write the better!

features.title: How does it work?

home.seo-description: CoronaMail is a platform to aid with the coronavirus by sending letters to infected people. Join us now and start spreading the love in times of virus!
home.body0: Write letters to the sick or isolated people because of the Covid-19 and send them your love and support.
home.body1: Read letters if you're affected and get all the strength needed to overcome this virus.
